meanings.definition: To make (a process) automatic or mechanical.
meanings.sent1: The factory started mechanizing its production line to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to mechanize their packaging process to save time.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would mechanize the recipe to make cooking easier.
meanings.sent4: The idea of mechanizing the entire operation seemed like a futuristic dream.
meanings.sent5: Mechanizing the task made it seem like a well-oiled machine.

meanings.sent1: The farmer mechanized his tractor with the latest technology.
meanings.sent2: The construction company mechanized their tools for faster work.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to mechanize their toys to play 'industrial revolution'.
meanings.sent4: She mechanized her kitchen with all the gadgets available in the market.
meanings.sent5: Mechanizing the workshop transformed it into a high-tech facility.

meanings.definition: To operate or perform by machinery.
meanings.sent1: The old printing press was mechanized to keep up with modern demands.
meanings.sent2: The company mechanized the assembly line to increase production speed.
meanings.sent3: The idea of mechanizing the dance routine with robots amused the audience.
meanings.sent4: She mechanized her daily chores to have more free time.
meanings.sent5: Mechanizing the task allowed for precision and consistency.
